entry.title: impossibly possible
entry.summary:
Author: alleousai

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 31,919Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 719

Summary: "The screen lit up. There was Peter, in his hoodie, AirPods dangling from his ears, looking for all the world a nodding seal whilst the Vicki lady interrogated him: kiss, marry or kill. And then his own voice, the barest cadence of a tremor: “Um, kiss Nightwing …marry Red Hood, kill Red Robin?” A strangled, animal sound tore from his throat. He was fucked." or: Peter, didn't ask for any of it: he ends up in a place called Gotham, goes viral on the internet, runs into Superman's ex-wife, gets an internship at the Daily Planet…all the while getting pursued by the Red Hood + the no-more-the-less demented Batfamily. He tried, okay? (He messes it up with two potential love interests + goes to university + becomes famous).

entry.title: good morning, sunshine
entry.summary:
Author: mikaminato

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,096Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 24

Summary: The corners of Clark's mouth lift; a genuine, unassuming smile that has no purpose and no pretense. His bright blue eyes fix on Bruce, warm and inviting. And with nothing more than that smile and the warmth in his gaze, Bruce understands the message as clearly as if he'd spoken the words: There's no need to be alone today. Or ever. Loneliness feels like a distant memory the moment his eyes lands on Clark. The thought forms not with the pain of a wound reopening, but with a quiet, tender realization that makes the corners of his own lips twitch. He almost feels like smiling back. Even now, months after they started dating, smiling feels like a muscle he has to work for. But Clark makes him want to practice.   (Or, Bruce, Clark, and a quiet morning.)

entry.title: Two Heroes and a Baby
entry.summary:
Author: xxEmilee_Lunaxx

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 66,587Chapters: 18/?Kudos: 391

Summary: In this AU, 19-year-old Bruce Wayne adopts 4-year-old Dick Grayson after he is orphaned by a tragic event at Haly's Circus. Bruce is in over his head trying to juggle establishing himself as a responsible and valuable asset to Wayne Enterprises, beginning his vigilante work in Gotham as The Batman, and parenting a young child despite not knowing where to start. After struggling to get good press and constantly being seen as an irresponsible nepo baby, he sets up an interview at The Daily Planet. That's where he meets 19-year-old intern Clark Kent, who is eager to write a good story to begin his career as a journalist. After Clark agrees to keep an eye on Dick during his interview, Bruce realizes he has a knack for watching children, especially young Dick Grayson. Bruce asks Clark to come live with him at Wayne Manor on a 6 month assignment as Dick's nanny, and in return, will let Clark write the story of a lifetime--an expose on his life that no other reporter has even come close to. Clark reluctantly agrees, but is hiding a secret from Bruce--his life as the superhero, Superman! As the two begin their friendship and double lives as heroes, they learn valuable lessons in friendship, love, and parenting.

entry.title: I Know You’re Tired, Well I’m Tired Too
entry.summary:
Author: Kingiic

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,352Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 2

Summary: Light. All consuming and wet.The chords of blackness receded from the peripherals of his vision. Nothing remained of the evidence. The beast from seconds ago was nothing more than a literal stain on Gordon’s white button up. And Light; totally absolute in its buzzing heat. Gordon lifted his arm to shield his eyes from the beams.In an instant, the light dulled. Gordon took a moment to rub his eyes and readjust himself before looking at the six-foot bat signal pointing directly at him. Perched on the metal neck, standing just behind the dimmed light, stood the half-illuminated silhouette of the Batman.“We need to talk.” Began the familiar voice, low and stern. “Are you functional?”_______________Someone is making clones of this world’s most powerful individuals, Gotham is battling fascism and corruption in the midst of a mayoral race, and Batman must learn how to fight fire with fire, or he’ll have to make a few new friends.

entry.title: Before I Was Superman, I Met Him. While I was Superman, I Loved Him.
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 29,218Chapters: 16/16Kudos: 58

Summary: The story follows a young Clark Kent, still new to Metropolis, still unsure of himself, and still hiding the full extent of his powers, with comedy and sexual tension. When he’s assigned to cover a Wayne Foundation gala in Gotham, he meets Bruce Wayne for the first time and... Batman, who inspires him to embrace his power and become Superman. Bruce asks Clark to dinner, possibly, eventually to be something more. Each "exploratory evening", as Bruce called it, fueled a growing tension between them that is starting to become harder to ignore. Clark is disappointed to learn, however, that while Bruce was obsessed with Clark, Batman wanted nothing to do with Superman. He's left wondering how a relationship could work when he knows Bruce's most hidden secret, and Bruce is in the dark about his. Yet, despite this emotional turmoil, Clark finds it harder and harder to ignore the tension and his desire to touch Bruce in ways that exceeded all sense of professionalism.
